content:
GB 152 483col A Summary Description of the papers of Labour CND Modern Records Centre
University of Warwick Library Coventry, CV4 7AL United Kingdom Tel: 024 7652 4219 Fax: 024 7652 4211 Email: archives@warwick.ac.uk
Finding aid encoded manually: Richard Temple, February 2004. Revised March 29, 2004. 16 June 2005 Catalogue record converted to EAD2002, May 2005. GB 152 MSS.483 Labour CND 1984-2000 Modern Records Centre, University of Warwick Library 0.208 cubic metres Labour CND English

Labour CND was formed in 1979 and has continued since then to promote support for nuclear disarmament within the Labour Party. It has done this by enlisting support for this amongst Labour Party and trade union members and organisations. Labour CND comprises supporters of the Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament (CND) who are also members of the Labour Party.

Executive Committee minutes and papers, 1984-2000; Committee for Peace in the Balkans papers, 1997-1999; resolutions to Labour Party conferences, 1983-2000; correspondence with constituency and Labour Party secretaries, 1990-2000.

The Labour CND archive has been preserved in the original arrangement used by the depositor.

This collection was deposited in the Centre by Carol Turner on behalf of Labour CND in February 2004.

This collection has not been weeded.

Further deposits are expected.

A few files are closed until 2017-2030. The rest of the deposit is open without restriction.

There are no restrictions on the use of this archive, apart from the requirements of copyright law.

A catalogue to file level is available in the Centre's searchroom.

An authority record exists for Labour CND (GB 152 AAR2778).

Other papers held at the Centre are the Mary Brennan Peace Movement Papers (MSS.410), Dr James Hinton's Papers (MSS.343), Victor Gollancz's papers (MSS.157), Christian CND (MSS.462), and the West Midlands Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament Papers (MSS.417).

The British Library of Political and Economic Science holds a large group of national administrative records and minutes and papers of the London region CND, Youth CND, and Colleges and Universities CND. The papers of the Aberystwyth Nuclear Weapons Committee, and CND Cymru are in the National Library of Wales.

 Labour Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament Campaign for Peace in the Balkans Antinuclear movement Peace movements
